greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A generalization of triangles A071951 (Legendre-Stirling) and A089504.
comment: This triangle underlies the array entry A090214 ((4,4)-generalized Stirling2).
link: R. B. Corcino, K. J. M. Gonzales, M. J. C. Loquias and E. L. Tan, Dually weighted Stirling-type sequences, arXiv preprint arXiv:1302.4694 [math.CO], 2013.
R. B. Corcino, K. J. M. Gonzales, M. J. C. Loquias and E. L. Tan, Dually weighted Stirling-type sequences, Europ. J. Combin., 43, 2015, 55-67.
formula: G.f. for m-th column sequence (without leading zeros and m>=1) is 1/product(1-fallfac(r+3, 4)*x, r=1..m) with fallfac(n, k) := A008279(n, k) (falling factorials).
a(n, m) = sum(A089515(m, p)*fallfac(p, 4)^(n-m), p=1..m)/D(m) if n>=m>=1 else 0; with D(m) := A089516(m).
mathematica: max = 10; f[m_] := 1/Product[1-FactorialPower[r+3, 4]*x, {r, 1, m}]; col[m_] := CoefficientList[f[m] + O[x]^(max-m+1), x]; a[n_, m_] := col[m][[n-m+1]]; Table[a[n, m], {n, 1, max}, {m, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 01 2016 *)
xref: The column sequences (without leading zeros) are A009968 (powers of 24), etc.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Dec 01 2003
